page.title: 15THE SAMPFORDS AIRFIELD
page.content: This airfield was used in world war two.It was linked with another one in Debden.The runway is about one third of a mile long.It is thought to be linked with the wreck of a hurricane found in Great Sampford in a field .Lots of wreckage was found.Last year the engine was found.The other plane involved in the crash was found in Hempstead wood.The planes at the airfield mostly were hurricanes and spitfires.Some of the planes have been donated to Duxford Airfield.A lot of parachuting was done there for practice. A lot of bullets have been found up there and some of them are alive.The Sampfords airfield is about 2 miles away from here.It is near Tindon End.There is nothing left of the airfield now.It is all used for farm land.
